intro: Maba mannii, commonly known as the African milkwood tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing a single seed. It is known for its ability to exude a milky sap when wounded, which has been used traditionally for various purposes. The tree is often found in dry, rocky habitats and plays a role in local ecosystems.
